scrabble

Class LetterBag

  • java.lang.Object
    • scrabble.LetterBag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LetterContainer

    public class LetterBag
extends java.lang.Object
implements LetterContainer
    Class that represents a letter bag. A Bag consists of a number of letters with a predefined distribution. This is extracted from a bundle and it is used to fill the bag in the begining of the game.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    George Piskas

    • Constructor Detail

      • LetterBag

        public LetterBag()
        LetterBag constructor. Uses localization bundles to fill the bag with letters in the right language and distribution.
        We finally have a shuffled Letter Bag ArrayList.

      • newRack

        public java.util.ArrayList<Letter> newRack(int rackSize)
        Creates an ArrayList of letters to fill the new player's rack. Used only in the beggining of the game, when players join the game.
        Parameters:
        rackSize - size of the new rack
        Returns:
        the letters to fill the new rack

      • refillLetters

        public java.util.ArrayList<Letter> refillLetters(int refillAmount)
        Refills a player's rack after he used letters from his rack. Refills the given amount of letters and removes them from the bag. If the bag is emptied during letter extraction, player recieves all the letters left.
        Parameters:
        refillAmount - number letters to return
        Returns:
        the new letters

      • refreshLetters

        public java.util.ArrayList<Letter> refreshLetters(java.util.ArrayList<Letter> returnedLtrs)
        Refreshes letter by player request. If a player wants to refresh his letters from his rack, the function returns the old ones to the bag and extracts new, randomly generated letters.
        Parameters:
        returnedLtrs - the letters the player returned to the bag
        Returns:
        the letter the player will recieve
